titles.title: To express the sense of the Congress that the President should convene a White House Conference on Savings.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Financial Institutions Supervision, Regulation and Deposit Insurance.

committee.name: House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs
House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs
committee.subcommittee: Financial Institutions Supervision, Regulation and Deposit Insurance

bill.summary: 2/24/1994--Introduced. Calls for the President to convene a White House Conference on Savings to address: (1) the drop in the rate of personal savings and investment in the United States; (2) the effects of the decline in domestic savings on America's need to borrow capital abroad and on the U.S. economy, capital formation, investment, research and development, new technologies, entrepreneurship, employment, and job creation; and (3) possible actions to increase the rate of personal savings.
